verses.verse: And Abram <S%H87><s%> went <S%H5927><s%> up out of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> he, and his wife, <S%H802><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> that he had, and Lot <S%H3876><s%> with him, into the south. <S%H5045><s%>
And Abram <S%H87><s%> was very <S%H3966><s%> rich <S%H3513><s%> in cattle, <S%H4735><s%> in silver, <S%H3701><s%> and in gold. <S%H2091><s%>

And he went <S%H3212><s%> on his journeys <S%H4550><s%> from the south <S%H5045><s%> even to Bethel, <S%H1008><s%> to the place <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H834><s%> his tent <S%H168><s%> had been <S%H1961><s%> at the beginning, <S%H8462><s%> between <S%H996><s%> Bethel <S%H1008><s%> and Hai; <S%H5857><s%>

To the place <S%H4725><s%> of the altar, <S%H4196><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had made <S%H6213><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> at the first: <S%H7223><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> Abram <S%H87><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> on the name <S%H8034><s%> of the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>
And Lot <S%H3876><s%> also, <S%H1571><s%> which went <S%H1980><s%> with Abram, <S%H87><s%> had <S%H1961><s%> flocks, <S%H6629><s%> and herds, <S%H1241><s%> and tents. <S%H168><s%>

And the land <S%H776><s%> was not able <S%H5375><s%> to bear <S%H5375><s%> them, that they might dwell <S%H3427><s%> together: <S%H3162><s%> for their substance <S%H7399><s%> was great, <S%H7227><s%> so that they could <S%H3201><s%> not dwell <S%H3427><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>

And there was a strife <S%H7379><s%> between <S%H996><s%> the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Abram's <S%H87><s%> cattle <S%H4735><s%> and the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Lot's <S%H3876><s%> cattle: <S%H4735><s%> and the Canaanite <S%H3669><s%> and the Perizzite <S%H6522><s%> dwelled <S%H3427><s%> then <S%H227><s%> in the land. <S%H776><s%>

And Abram <S%H87><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Lot, <S%H3876><s%> Let there be no <S%H408><s%> strife, <S%H4808><s%> I pray <S%H4994><s%> you, between <S%H996><s%> me and you, and between <S%H996><s%> my herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> and your herdsmen; <S%H7462><s%> for we be brothers. <S%H251><s%>

Is not the whole <S%H3605><s%> land <S%H776><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you? separate <S%H6504><s%> yourself, I pray <S%H4994><s%> you, from me: if <S%H518><s%> you will take the left <S%H8040><s%> hand, <S%H8041><s%> then I will go to the right; <S%H3231><s%> or if <S%H518><s%> you depart to the right <S%H3225><s%> hand, <S%H3225><s%> then I will go to the left. <S%H8041><s%>

And Lot <S%H3876><s%> lifted <S%H5375><s%> up his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and beheld <S%H7200><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the plain <S%H3603><s%> of Jordan, <S%H3383><s%> that it was well watered <S%H4945><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> where, before <S%H6440><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> destroyed <S%H7843><s%> Sodom <S%H5467><s%> and Gomorrah, <S%H6017><s%> even as the garden <S%H1588><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> like the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> as you come <S%H935><s%> to Zoar. <S%H6820><s%>

Then Lot <S%H3876><s%> chose <S%H977><s%> him all <S%H3605><s%> the plain <S%H3603><s%> of Jordan; <S%H3383><s%> and Lot <S%H3876><s%> journeyed <S%H5265><s%> east: <S%H6924><s%> and they separated <S%H6504><s%> themselves the one <S%H376><s%> from the other. <S%H251><s%>

Abram <S%H87><s%> dwelled <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> and Lot <S%H3876><s%> dwelled <S%H3427><s%> in the cities <S%H5892><s%> of the plain, <S%H3603><s%> and pitched <S%H167><s%> his tent <S%H167><s%> toward <S%H5704><s%> Sodom. <S%H5467><s%>
But the men <S%H582><s%> of Sodom <S%H5467><s%> were wicked <S%H7451><s%> and sinners <S%H2400><s%> before the LORD <S%H3068><s%> exceedingly. <S%H3966><s%>

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Abram, <S%H87><s%> after <S%H310><s%> that Lot <S%H3876><s%> was separated <S%H6504><s%> from him, Lift <S%H5375><s%> up now your eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and look <S%H7200><s%> from the place <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> you are northward, <S%H6828><s%> and southward, <S%H5045><s%> and eastward, <S%H6924><s%> and westward: <S%H3220><s%>
For all <S%H3605><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you see, <S%H7200><s%> to you will I give <S%H5414><s%> it, and to your seed <S%H2233><s%> for ever. <S%H5769><s%>

And I will make <S%H7760><s%> your seed <S%H2233><s%> as the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth: <S%H776><s%> so <S%H834><s%> that if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> can <S%H3201><s%> number <S%H4487><s%> the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> then shall your seed <S%H2233><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> be numbered. <S%H4487><s%>
Arise, <S%H6965><s%> walk <S%H1980><s%> through the land <S%H776><s%> in the length <S%H753><s%> of it and in the breadth <S%H7341><s%> of it; for I will give <S%H5414><s%> it to you.

Then Abram <S%H87><s%> removed <S%H167><s%> his tent, <S%H167><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> and dwelled <S%H3427><s%> in the plain <S%H436><s%> of Mamre, <S%H4471><s%> which is in Hebron, <S%H2275><s%> and built <S%H1129><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> to the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>
